content.title: Mission on Integrated Development of Horticulture- NHM and HMNEH
content.department: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
content.details: MIDH covers horticulture items such as fruits, vegetables, root & tuber crops, mushrooms, spices, flowers, aromatic plants, coconut, cashew, cocoa, and bamboo. It provides technical advice and administrative support to State Governments/State Horticulture Missions (SHMs) for horticulture-related activities.
benefits: Increase in productivity of crops through diversification
Promotion of R&D technologies for cultivation, production, post-harvest management and processing
Improvement in post-harvest management, processing for value addition and marketing infrastructure
content.application_process: Offline. Interested beneficiaries can contact the District Horticulture Officer/Block Horticulture Officer to apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: Can a beneficiary avail assistance for similar activity from two sub schemes of MIDH, like for cold storage?
faqs.answer: No. As a general principle, subsidy assistance for similar activity cannot be availed from two different schemes.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of Assistance under MIDH for organizing Seminars, Workshops and other HRD activities?
faqs.answer: Provision exists under MIDH for organizing seminars, conferences, workshops, exhibitions, Kisan Melas, horticulture shows etc for creating awareness among farmers.

faqs.question: Can a nursery be set up in less than one hectare?
faqs.answer: No. NHM scheme envisages a minimum area of one hectare for setting up a viable nursery to produce quality planting material.
